item.title: BoonSoh...say what?!
item.description:
BoonSoh...say what?!

Hi Everyone! Welcome to my site.

item.title: City Guide Spotlight: New York City
item.description:
City Guide Spotlight: New York City

A few days ahead of NYC's hectic and inspiring Armory Week, Scope and Pulse Art Fairs, we embarked upon an overhaul of our NYC City Guide. While there were some stalwarts that needed to be added, New York City's ever-evolving nature means plenty of brand new spots made the list.

item.title: Remembering Prince: What The Purple One Can Teach You About Creativity
item.description:
Remembering Prince: What The Purple One Can Teach You About Creativity

Join Entrepreneur and today's most influential business innovators in Denver, May 4. Register Now " Prince, a pioneering musician and creative, died today at 57. This game-changing artist merged his special take on funk and rock into 39 albums, creating classics such as Purple Rain and Little Red Corvette.

item.title: How to Book Better Airbnbs for Less Money
item.description:
How to Book Better Airbnbs for Less Money

How to successfully book your first-choice listings and get them for cheaper.

item.title: What it's like to ride in the Tesla Model 3
item.description:
What it's like to ride in the Tesla Model 3

HAWTHORNE, California - I've had a terrible flu all week. My body aches, my head is pounding, and my throat feels like it might fall out of my neck. Right now, though, I'm riding in the Tesla Model 3, one of the most hotly anticipated cars in the world...

item.title: 33 Women Doing Amazing Things in Graphic Design
item.description:
33 Women Doing Amazing Things in Graphic Design

These talented women have unleashed their creativity and skills on the world of graphic design. Paula Scher is an American graphic designer, illustrator, and educator, and the first female Principal at . She started experimenting with typography in the early 1980s and looked to historic design sources such as Russian Constructivism, obscure and little-used typefaces, and her seemingly unlimited imagination.

item.title: 7 Gadgets That'll Actually Get You Excited to Work Out
item.description:
7 Gadgets That'll Actually Get You Excited to Work Out

Gadgets and devices that make working out more enjoyable, including games, music players, and muscle trackers.

item.title: A Disney space station? It no longer seems like such a goofy idea
item.description:
A Disney space station? It no longer seems like such a goofy idea

Throughout our planet's space-faring history, there have been two major impediments to putting a lot of private citizens into orbit. Only governments have had spacecraft, and there have been only a few, government-controlled, space stations to visit. But now that may finally changing in a big way.

item.title: Spotify's Design Lead on Why Side Projects Should Be Stupid
item.description:
Spotify's Design Lead on Why Side Projects Should Be Stupid

Tobias van Schneider lives his life like one big side project. Today, he designs and builds new products for Spotify in New York, but he couldn't have predicted that when he dropped out of school at age 15 to work as an apprentice in a computer shop in Austria.

item.title: Why Tesla Will Destroy the Automobile Industry
item.description:
Why Tesla Will Destroy the Automobile Industry

If there's an example of a company about to disruptively innovate an entire industry, it's Tesla. Partly, this is because of raw technology--Tesla's is clearly superior to that of its competitors. Partly, it's because Tesla has a more efficient business model. As Slate recently pointed out, Tesla bypasses value-subtracting dealer franchises and universally disliked car salespeople.
